notes:
1. Concept

Scaling laws, or Affinity Laws, allow prediction of the performance of a turbomachine (pump or fan) if its speed ($N$) or impeller diameter ($D$) is changed.

2. Changing Speed (N) with Constant Diameter

  • Flow Rate: $Q_2 / Q_1 = N_2 / N_1$ (Linear)
  • Head/Pressure: $H_2 / H_1 = (N_2 / N_1)^2$ (Square)
  • Power: $P_2 / P_1 = (N_2 / N_1)^3$ (Cubic)

3. Changing Diameter (D) with Constant Speed

  • Flow Rate: $Q_2 / Q_1 = (D_2 / D_1)^3$
  • Head/Pressure: $H_2 / H_1 = (D_2 / D_1)^2$
  • Power: $P_2 / P_1 = (D_2 / D_1)^5$

solvedExamples.question: If the speed of a centrifugal pump is doubled, the power required to drive it increases by a factor of:
solvedExamples.explanation: According to the affinity laws, power is proportional to the cube of the rotational speed ($P \propto N^3$). $2^3 = 8$.

solvedExamples.question: A fan delivers 1000 cfm. If its speed is reduced by 50%, what is the new flow rate?
solvedExamples.explanation: Flow rate is directly proportional to speed ($Q \propto N$). If speed is halved, flow rate is halved. $1000 \times 0.5 = 500$ cfm.
